reviewText:
The film opens showing us a haunted house, Ouija Board, and a killing. It then shift to moody Sara going camping with her boyfriend. She hasn't forgiven her dad as she believes "mistake define who we are." She applies that belief to the Ouija ghost/killer (Denise Hernandez) who attaches herself to Sara (Tara Shayne). This irks the "thin skin" spirit who forces Sara to kill or else.

The movie uses whispers, shadows and dreams to create terror. People die, but we are spared seeing any horrific killings, i.e. no need for special effects, just get actors who can play dead. This is a "me-too" low budget Ouija Board film. Listed as "You Will Kill" at IMDB. Tara Shayne's character as a snippy teen was not well developed.

Guide: No swearing, sex, or nudity. Walmart $9.96
Loved the movie! Kept me on the edge of my seat and the effects were great. Strongly recommend
Thought it was great! Story was awesome! Made me jump lighting and camera work amazing! Will highly recommend!!!!
If you like boring scary movies, then you should purchase this movie. I fell asleep watching this three times.

What a mess.  Was there a point to that?

Random girl is randomly haunted by a random ghost because someone used a ouija board? Throw in some pointless, random deaths and random jump scares.  There you have it.

Life is short.  You'll never get this time back.  Skip it.
Ezpz.

Oh god, there only scary thing in this movie is how badly the main actress is at acting.  The movie does an okay-ish job at a few scares, but parts of the script/acting are just laughably bad.  If I had to listen to her whine one more time about regrets or be inexplicably angry at people, I'd have done something *I* would regret.  I swear to god by the end of the movie I was rooting for the evil spirit to just end her quickly.  And it never stops hitting you over the head with the stupid moral about forgiving people's mistakes.

Maybe the director was preemptively asking forgiveness for making this movie.

I did like the movie. It wasn't great, but it wasn't horrible either.  I don't understand the reviews that say the acting is bad. I thought most of the acting was awesome (especially for a 'horror' movie!) .  About that:  I'm not sure it should be classified a horror movie. It has aspects of horror, sure, but it's more like a scary drama than a horror flick.
A recurring sentence in this movie is " regrets can't change what has happened".  That is so true, I regret watching this movie and I can't un-see it.

Damn guess these peeps didn't watch "The Exorcist" or they would'a known don't mess with a Ouija board cuz it's not your friend. Why do they never learn see that board quickly haul tail in the opposite direction? This is a good movie it was really scary and well done

Might as well be called "Hey Folks, Kids are Stupid!"

The whole premise begins with three kids going out on a campout who makes a random house stop because the third wheel had to take a piss. They end up walking into a house covered in crime tape (REALLY?) not to mention, the main girl touches the door and all, yeah that'll go over well with CSI. Then their dopey third wheel friend finds a Ouija board. I didn't bother watching the rest. I kind of skipped ahead and it falls into the whole "My house is haunted now, let's call in an exorcist" trope. The camera shots aren't bad but the acting is atrocious.
I made it 5 minutes in. 5 minutes. The acting is terrible. I didn't want to waste an hour sticking around and "giving it a shot", because the opening scenes were cringey enough.
Weak movie, keep working on it, you'll get better. to predictable

I really enjoyed this movie because it was so different than the typical "Ouija" movies. I have seen 3 different Ouija movies now and they all have the same story line: Young adults use a Ouija board-a spirit comes out-and starts killing them 1 by 1. What happened in this Ouija movie was completely different-not the typical Ouija movie story line-which I found really refreshing. You have to be a little patient in the beginning, the suspense is slow to start. But if you can get past the first 20 min. the movie is great! And Oh yes, you better do what she says :)

While one reviewer asked where WAS the connection between the two families, they obviously weren't paying attention. The best friend grabbed the Ouija board from the first family's home and brought it with him on the camping trip, the same board later used by the main character's during the camping trip, there's your link. The performances were well acted, the suspense, twists, and paranormal haunting was believable (after all, it's a movie), and I thought it deserved a great rating. I will definitely be watching this one again.

A new twist on the Ouija board , but the film didn't really concentrate or center itself around it. It was a unique type of storyline which was different for a refreshing change in this genre. I thought the acting was pretty good, the plot and storyline was all portrayed well . It kept me on the edge of my seat the whole time. I enjoyed it. I would recommend it highly to others.

Compared to some other movies on Amazon lately with all the fake reviews I believe this deserves better ratings (5 stars to boost the total). The acting wasn't horrible or cheesy, and the effects were actually pretty spooky in my opinion...Nana was flipping awesome. Even though it was a little "been there done that" plot-wise, that's most horror flicks these days. It's hard to watch a horror flick and actually expect to be scared anymore (I feel like I've seen em all).  I think because of this, it's really hard to figure out what's worth it on Amazon. This one was NOT a waste of time-in my opinion. It was a little dark on the tablet visually, and that was the worst of it. Bravo
